The answer to that question is pretty straightforward. The UNIX operating system
requires that every IO device driver provide five standard functions:
. The signatures of those functions must be identical for every IO
data structure contains five pointers to functions. In our example, it might look

The IO driver for the console will define those functions and load up a
structure with their addressesâ€”something like this:
Click here to view code image
struct FILE console = {open, close, read, write, seek};
, and if it points to the console data structure, then
